FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco Logistics - Eagle Point Tank Farm and Terminal, hereafter known as Eagle Point, is a refined petroleum product storage and distribution facility in the vicinity of West Deptford, NJ. The facility handles and stores various grades of unleaded gasoline, low-sulfur diesel, No. 2 fuel oil, Butane, Pentane, Ethanol, and various other petroleum based additives.



The facility has fixed inventories of Butane and Pentane. Butane is received and unloaded via truck. Butane is stored in four (4) 12,000 barrel spheres. Butane is injected into Gasoline streams throughout the facility. Pentane is received by truck and stored in one (1) 60,000-gallon storage vessel. Pentane is injected into regular and premium unleaded gasoline lines feeding the site gasoline truck loading rack. Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point (<250oF) feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm) on the vessel, emergency shutoff devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal (pressure) reliefs, and grounding/interlock devices.



Access to the Eagle Point Terminal is restricted to authorized employees, management personnel, authorized contractors/visitors and tenants. Eagle Point is designed, operated and maintained in a manner that protects the health and safety of our employees, contractors and the community in which we operate. We promote health, safety, and the environment through programs of awareness, compliance, prevention and protection. These programs include a combination of accidental release prevention and emergency response planning.



The following is a summary of the general accident prevention programs in place at the facility. The covered processes at Eagle Point are regulated by the EPA RMP regulation 40 CFR Part 68, NJDEP Toxic Catastrophe Prevention Act program N.J.A.C. 7:31 (1-6) and the OSHA Process Safety Management standard 29 CFR 1910.119. These programs constitute the framework by which process safety

and accident prevention are managed in the facility. Eagle Point complies with the National Fire Protection Association's (NFPA's) Flammable and Combustible Liquids Code (NFPA 30 [2012]) and Liquefied Petroleum Gas Code (NFPA 58 [2014]).



In addition to the presence of appropriate controls to prevent possible releases, if a release does occur, an Integrated Contingency Plan (ICP) is in place for the Facility and response activities are coordinated with the West Deptford Township Volunteer Fire Department and West Deptford Township LEPC.



No accidents/incidents have occurred on the covered process in the last five-years.



At Sunoco Logistics Eagle Point Tank Farm and Terminal we continually strive to make the safest and most reliable workplace possible for our employees, our neighbors and our community. The facility's focus is safe, reliable and environmentally sound operations. The goal of Eagle Point is to demonstrate continuous improvement in our health, environmental and safety performance. In addition, we will work cooperatively with our neighbors to ensure the health, environment, safety and security of Eagle Point Tank Farm and Terminal and surrounding community.
